workflow.name: Automate API FAQ quality testing with GPT-4o-mini, Google Sheets & Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## Description:
Keep your API documentation accurate and reliable with this n8n automation template.
 The workflow automatically tests your FAQ content related to authentication and rate limits, evaluating each answer using Azure OpenAI GPT-4o-mini for completeness, edge-case coverage, and technical clarity. It logs all results to Google Sheets, scores FAQs from 0‚Äì10, and sends Slack alerts when low-quality answers are detected.
Ideal for API teams, developer relations managers, and technical writers who want to maintain high-quality documentation with zero manual review effort.

## ‚úÖ What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Manual Trigger or On-Demand Run
 Start the evaluation anytime you update your FAQs ‚Äî perfect for regression testing before documentation releases.

üìñ Fetch FAQ Q&A from Google Sheets
 Reads FAQ questions and answers from your designated test sheet (columns A:B). Each Q&A pair becomes a test case for AI evaluation.

ü§ñ AI Evaluation via GPT-4o-mini
 Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4o-mini to evaluate how well each FAQ covers critical aspects of API authentication and rate limiting.
 The AI provides a numeric score (0‚Äì10) and a short explanation.

üîç Parse & Format AI Results
 Extracts structured JSON data (Question, Score, Explanation, Timestamp) and prepares it for reporting and filtering.

üíæ Save Evaluation to Google Sheets
 Appends all results to a Results Sheet (A:D) ‚Äî creating a running history of FAQ quality audits.

‚ö†Ô∏è Filter for Low-Scoring FAQs
 Identifies any FAQ with a score below 7, flagging them as needing review or rewrite.

üîî Send Slack Alerts for Weak Entries
 Posts an alert message in your chosen Slack channel, including:
The question text
Score received
AI‚Äôs explanation
Link to the full results sheet
This ensures your documentation team can quickly address weak or incomplete FAQ answers.

## üß† Key Features
 ü§ñ AI-powered FAQ quality scoring (0‚Äì10)
 üìä Automated tracking of doc health over time
 üì• Seamless Google Sheets integration for results storage
 ‚öôÔ∏è Slack notifications for underperforming FAQs
 üß© Ideal for continuous documentation improvement

## üíº Use Cases
 üìò Validate FAQ accuracy before API documentation updates
 ‚ö° Auto-test new FAQ sets during content refresh cycles
 üß† Ensure API rate limit and auth topics cover all edge cases
 üì¢ Alert documentation owners about weak answers instantly

## üì¶ Required Integrations
- Google Sheets API ‚Äì for reading and storing FAQs and test results
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini) ‚Äì for evaluating FAQ coverage and clarity
- Slack API ‚Äì for sending quality alerts and notifications

## üéØ Why Use This Template?
 ‚úÖ Ensures API FAQ accuracy and completeness automatically
 ‚úÖ Replaces tedious manual content reviews with AI scoring
 ‚úÖ Builds an ongoing record of documentation improvements
 ‚úÖ Keeps technical FAQs consistent, relevant, and developer-friendly

workflow.name: API Rate Limit & Auth FAQ Test

parameters.content:
## üì• Data Input

Fetches FAQ data from Google Sheets and validates it before processing.

## ü§ñ AI Evaluation

Scores each FAQ using GPT-4o-mini based on completeness, clarity, technical accuracy, and actionability.

## üíæ Results Storage

Saves detailed scores to Results sheet and aggregated metrics to History sheet for trend tracking.

## üì¢ Notifications

Sends Slack alerts when critical or warning-level issues are detected, then emails a completion summary.

## How it works

This workflow automatically evaluates FAQ quality using AI (GPT-4o-mini), scores each entry (0-10), and tracks improvements over time. It reads FAQs from Google Sheets, gets AI feedback on completeness and clarity, then saves detailed results and sends Slack alerts for low-scoring content.

**Key features:** Historical tracking, severity-based alerts (üî¥ Critical, ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning, ‚úÖ Good), batch processing, and comprehensive error handling.

## Setup steps

1. **Connect accounts:** Add Google Sheets OAuth and Azure OpenAI credentials
2. **Configure Sheet ID:** Update the Configuration node with your Google Sheet ID (found in the sheet URL)
3. **Set up Slack:** Add Slack webhook and update channel ID in Configuration node (optional)
4. **Prepare your sheet:** Create a sheet named "TestSet" with Question (Column A) and Answer (Column B)
5. **Run:** Click "Execute workflow" to start the quality check

parameters.text:
=You are an expert technical documentation reviewer specializing in API documentation, authentication systems, and rate limiting policies.

**Task:** Evaluate the quality and completeness of this FAQ entry.

**Question:** {{ $json.question }}

**Answer:** {{ $json.answer }}

**Evaluation Criteria:**
1. **Completeness (0-3 points)**: Does it address edge cases and scenarios?
2. **Clarity (0-3 points)**: Is the explanation clear and unambiguous?
3. **Technical Accuracy (0-2 points)**: Are technical details correct?
4. **Actionability (0-2 points)**: Can users act on this information?

**Output Requirements:**
Provide ONLY valid JSON with this exact structure:
{
  "score": <number 0-10>,
  "explanation": "<brief one-sentence explanation>",
  "strengths": "<what's good about this answer>",
  "improvements": "<specific suggestions for improvement>"
}

**Important:** Return ONLY the JSON object, no additional text.

options.systemMessage: You are a technical documentation quality analyst. Provide objective, constructive evaluations in valid JSON format only.

parameters.text:
=üö® *FAQ Quality Alert* üö®

{{ $json.summary_text }}

---

‚ö†Ô∏è *Action Required:*
{{ $json.critical_count > 0 ? 'üî¥ ' + $json.critical_count + ' CRITICAL issues need immediate attention\n' : '' }}{{ $json.warning_count > 0 ? '‚ö†Ô∏è ' + $json.warning_count + ' warnings should be reviewed\n' : '' }}
üìã View full details: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/{{ $json.sheet_id }}/edit#gid=0

*Run ID:* `{{ $json.run_id }}`

assignments.name: completion_message

With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
